poem:
**A Second Term**

In the land of the free,  
the wind carries whispers  
of power reshaped.  
Orders etched in haste,  
hands point, maps redrawn  
on parchment wearing thin.  
Voices rise, then fade  
under ceilings of silenced  
stars, where refugees dream  
of shores, unseen—  
answers to questions  
etched in the dust of  
uneasy promises.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
